metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5823 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Insufficient policy enforcement in service workers in Google Chrome priorto 74.0.3729.108 allowed a remote attacker to bypass navigationrestrictions via a crafted HTML page.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5823` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '75.0.3770.90-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
